result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Anthony Lamott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court did not order any condition time.  If the agent feels that a review is needed, the agent may contact the Court if anything changes.

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharge plus al other costs and surcharges, DNA surcharge.  Civil judgment if not paid.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications.

No contact with victim unless approved by agent.
No contact with firearms.

Attend parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Pay supervision fees.
Restitution set at zero.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Anthony Lamott in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Parties are in court for sentencing.
 Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:
- The court did not order any condition time. If the agent feels that a review is needed, the agent may contact the court if anything changes.
- Attend parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges and the DNA charge; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Michael Anthony Lamott in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 2 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 36 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Anthony Lamott in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea Hearing. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for a Plea Haeirng to branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Theresa L., Jessica C.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Anthony Lamott in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 23 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/15/15 @ 1:30pm
